repnme.cdata!:
Vietnam - Ho Chi Minh City Environmental
            Sanitation (Nhieu Loc-Thi Nghe Basin) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Ho Chi Minh City (HCMC)
            Environmental Sanitation (Nhieu Loc-Thi Nghe Basin) Project
            for Vietnam were as follows: overall outcome was moderately
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            and both the Bank and the Borrower performance were
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: the
            need to understand the political economy around the
            institutional decentralization process in Vietnam. Despite
            intensive efforts to set up a realistic implementation
            agenda, it was not possible to predict the time for approval
            processes on the government side or the reasons behind the
            additional reviews at different government levels.
            Construction in dense urban environments: in cities like
            HCMC urban utilities need to start thinking of mapping their
            infrastructure using Geographic Information System (GIS)
            tools. Project implementation period: large infrastructure
            investments in challenging urban environments need
            sufficient implementation time. In such cases, phasing of
            the investments should be considered - either through an
            adaptable programmatic loan or through discrete Bank
            projects where it is clear that activities can start and
            finish within 5 years.

repnme.cdata!:
Viet Nam - Ho Chi Minh City Environmental
            Sanitation (Nhieu Loc-Thi Nghe Basin) Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Ho Chi
            Minh City Environmental Sanitation (Nhieu Loc-Thi Nghe
            Basin) Project is to reduce the incidence of flooding and
            increase the collection of wastewater in the Nhieu Loc Thi
            Nghe (NLTN) Basin in Ho Chi Minh City (HCMC), in an
            environmentally and financially sustainable manner. The
            project restructuring involves a minor changes related to
            project financing. A change in the withdrawal conditions for
            the additional credit will be made to allow for the
            retroactive financing of eligible payments to be made prior
            to May 25, 2010 but on or after May 25, 2009. This change
            will allow for retroactive financing to be made for up to
            one year from the date of the additional credit signing. The
            reallocation is necessary to so that the final disbursement
            allocations will be consistent with the actual disbursed
            amounts. The credit closing date was extended several times
            and in March 2010 an additional financing credit of SDR58
            million was approved, together with a revised closing date
            of December 31, 2011.

            Environmental Sanitation (Nhieu Loc-Thi Nghe Basin) Project

repnme.cdata!:
Viet Nam - Ho Chi Minh City Environmental
            Sanitation (Nhieu Loc-Thi Nghe Basin) Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Ho Chi
            Minh City Environmental Sanitation (Nhieu Loc-Thi Nghe
            Basin) Project is to reduce the incidence of flooding and
            increase the collection of wastewater in the Nhieu Loc Thi
            Nghe (NLTN) Basin in Ho Chi Minh City (HCMC), in an
            environmentally and financially sustainable manner. The
            extension is necessary to complete on- going works nearing
            completion. All International Development Association (IDA)
            funds are committed. The remaining work, which is expected
            to be completed by the end of April 2012, consists of: 1)
            soils stabilization around the canal interfaces with
            bridges; 2) the fabrication and installation of the
            temporary sewer outfall in the Saigon River; and 3) the
            remaining canal dredging work. The closing date of the
            project will be extended from December 31, 2011 until June
            30, 2012. This will be the fifth extension of the project.

display_title.display_title:
Viet Nam - Ho Chi Minh City
            Environmental Sanitation (Nhieu Loc-Thi Nghe Basin) Project
            : restructuring : Main report
